website_summaries.verdict: While the Grip-It rug pad may not provide much cushioning, it does provide a strong grip on most flooring types. Ideal for backing smaller area rugs. Can be used for indoor or outdoor applications.
pros: Polymer-covered grid is non-slip on both sides
Mesh design allows air to circulate under and through area rugs
Grid system makes customized trimming much easier
cons: Mesh can adhere to "sticky" hardwood floors and leave waffle marks
Grid pattern larger and wider than expected
Common dust build-up can weaken grip over time

customer_reviews.title: Ruined sealed concrete
customer_reviews.text: This nonslip rug pad sticks to the floor more than needed,but not at all to the rug I tried to prevent from sliding around. When I pulled up said rug and rug pad, a grid of foam dots remained. After several attempts with different cleaners,brushes and scrapers, the dots remain! It appears to have even etched the floor. If I could give it a negative 5, I would. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: tmurf

customer_reviews.title: WILL RUIN YOUR HARDWOOD FLOORS!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE ON REAL WOOD FLOORS!!! I purchased this non-stick mat, because the reviews were pretty good. I found an accent rug for my living room, but I was afraid of ruining my beautiful new ash hardwood floors. The mat has left permanent marks on my floor. They would probably go away if we were to refinish the floors, which is very expensive, and probably will not need to be done for many years. I am very disappointed, and sick to my stomach over this purchase. I have tried various cleaners and polishes, and nothing works. I have attached a picture. It is a bit difficult to see in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: TeachInWI

customer_reviews.title: Holds the rug very well
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a few months and the rug stays nicely in place. I never think twice about it and that's about as perfect a recommendation as I can imagine for a product like this. I had trouble getting it exactly under the rug until I figured out the trick: 1. Turn the rug upside down on the floor 2. Place the pad on top of the rug 3. Tape each corner of the pad to the back of the carpet. Once you do this, you can pick up and move the rug as much as you want without ever having to line up the pad underneath again! It's really easy.
customer_reviews.author: pveman

customer_reviews.title: Seriously awful - NOT recommended
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a terrible product - owned several non-slip pads before and this is the worst quality. The rug moves MORE with this product than before. The pad stretches in all directions, is poorly made and should be pulled OFF of Amazon. I would like to be able to return this, but I'm beyond the 30 day period. Such a shame and waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: SAmazonShopperS

customer_reviews.title: Not cool.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to put under a 5x7 area rug in my tiled basement office. Received it 3 days ago, set it down and put the rug over it. Have been walking on the rug for a couple days, just rolled the rug and pad back and this pad has adhered itself to the tile floor. When I am able to peel it away it leaves small bits of it's foam stuck to the tile. Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE RUG PADS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This will ruin your hardwood floors...head my warning!!!! We had our hardwood floors refinished and let it cure for 3 weeks before putting our rugs with this padding underneath them. Three months later we pulled the rugs up to clean and are now left with an unsigntly waffle pattern on our beautiful hardwoods. Very discouraged and disappointed. I don't understand how this company is still in business and that more people aren't having such terrible problems. The cheap stuff that these are made from reacts with your floors and ruins them. The only way to get rid of the waffle pattern is to have them refinished.
customer_reviews.author: kulaif

customer_reviews.title: But the worst case I had to deal with was the damage ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pad over 1 1/2 years ago to protect my oak floors by the kitchen sink. My rugs. We're always moving around. But the worst case I had to deal with was the damage done to my floors. It was like someone took sandpaper to my floors. I am in the process now of redoing that section of floor in my kitchen by sanding it down to bare wood to fix the damage done by this pad. I think what happened is that because the rug wasn't held in place by the pad, the back of the rug scratched the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Campbell

customer_reviews.title: This pad will RUIN your floors!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT use this rug pad if you have hardwood, laminate, or Traffic Master floors! This pad will ruin your floors by imprinting/staining. I purchased this pad as well as 2 other sizes 9 months ago, and decided to remove the rug in that area. In 9 months my floor was ruined. There is no way to remove the staining. It's amazing that a product that cost less than $15.00 ruined floors that cost thousands of dollars. Do your research on this before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: TheBreeze

customer_reviews.title: This pad really works!
customer_reviews.text: Upon returning home from the hospital after a 2 week stay for unexplained food poisoning, I slipped on the new rug my wife had put down in the entry hall. This meant a return trip to the hospital for a broken right wrist and shattered left elbow and kneecap. She insisted that it was an accident and merely wanted to welcome me home with a new rug. I don't think that's true since her boyfriend signed the sales receipt for the rug. Anyway, now that I have my new Ultra Stop Non-Slip Rug Pad, I feel much more confident hobbling around and hope to use both arms soon.
customer_reviews.author: u2mcf101

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold a runner rug down at all.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't hold an 8 x 3 runner rug in place. With just slight foot pressure, the rug moved around on a laminate floor, on both ends! Won't buy this brand again. Yuk! Didn't work well at all. UPDATE: This was worthless! I put some under a doormat onto carpet, and it doesn't stay in place at all. I tried 3 different types of door entry mats, and not one stayed in place. It is actually dangerous, if you think you have good grip, and you find out it may be even MORE slippery than before! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME!
customer_reviews.author: IDMA

customer_reviews.title: RUINS FLOOR: Should be off the market!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY I would give this -5 stars if I could. It will RUIN your hardwood floor!!! I don't know how they sleep at night selling a product like this - it should be off the market entirely. I threw it away after I injured my arms trying to scrub this off of my apartment hardwood floors! It took half a bottle of GooGone and a STAINLESS STEEL BRUSH to get all this adhesive off! Do they make this with glue?! It's terrible. DO NOT BUY. I seriously regret it. I should have read the reviews before I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Results
customer_reviews.text: I had this pad on my floor for less than a week. When I lifted the rug to re-position it, the pad had left grid lines on my hardwood that were extremely difficult to clean off. This was in a room where the carpet wasn't walked on, so just the weight of the rug was enough to make the marks. I would not recommend this pad.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great price and durability to make a rug rag with
customer_reviews.text: I decided to make a 'rug rag' and was looking for an affordable rug pad that I would be able to thread fabric in and out of. This is a great size and was also a great price. Only a few of the outer rungs have separated/broken when I was pulling fabric through, and considering they do not appear to be that thick I am very pleased. I can't speak to the 'non-slip' aspect of this, but I would assume it would work very well for that normal purpose too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my dog crate to keep the cloth pet ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my dog crate to keep the cloth pet bed from slipping around on the plastic tray in the bottom. Good price ($10.99 when I bought it) and because I trimmed it to fit my dog's crate (26" X 40") I have plenty to spare for other uses around the house. We have tile floors so there is rarely a time I don't need this stuff be it for a throw rug or little circles to go under table legs so it doesn't slide around. BTW this stuff can go anywhere from drawers to keep silverware organizers in place to under electronics (Blu-Ray, stereo, etc...) on glass shelves.
customer_reviews.author: RayTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for patio furniture!
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed my patio furniture and cushions with a sealant to prevent water from ruining them. It didn’t occur to me that it would make them slippery. In looking for solutions, so many were so expensive. They work beautifully! The super slippery cushions stay right in place and I can pick up the mats and put then in the cushion box, along with the cushions, when we’re not using them. The 2x4 were ideal and only $4.66. The perfect solution!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: This thing SUCKS.  It doesn't do what we purchased it for.
customer_reviews.text: When we opened the package we could tell it probably wouldn't work and we were right. It doesn't work at all. It doesn't stop the rug from moving and it even moves under the rug making the rug even worse. If I could give it a 0 star I would! Don't bother, don't waste your money.. IT SUCKS.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamersland

customer_reviews.title: Rug Skid Stopped
customer_reviews.text: We needed to stop a small area rug at the back door from skidding. Three people with balance and hip issues do not need to fall. This product had to be attached with fabric glue. It doesn't just stick on or have any adhesion patches.
customer_reviews.author: Shiratha

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us, but that doesn't mean it won't work for you.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what is going to work for us, but this rug pad unfortunately didn't work. We've been trying to find a rug pad that will keep our rug in place. We've tried individual rug pads and now this larger sized rug pad and nothing seems to keep our rug. We have the rug in the middle of our family room and we have 3 kids running across it all day. We're starting to believe that we won't find any rug pads that will work. Perhaps we'll just bolt it down to the floor! LOL This rug pad may not work for us but it may still work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Katie and J

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed our floors
customer_reviews.text: I know for sure this mat didn’t have so many bad reviews when I bought it in 2016, or I wouldn’t have made the purchase. We pulled our rug up and discovered the mat had completely adhered to our hardwood floors. When we pulled it up it left a ton of residue. We have had to scrape it all off by hand, and it’s a 10x12’ space. Even after cleaning the whole floor by hand there is a shadow of a grid across our floor.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Bee

customer_reviews.title: Smells bad.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to prevent an area rug from sliding. The rug had been washed several times and the backing is coming off. It seems to help with the sliding, but it smells really bad. Kind of like urine ( at first I thought the dog peed somewhere). I'll try to get the smell out by putting it in the sun. I have not noticed any damage to the floor like other reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: These pads arrived along with the two rugs I ordered for $12 each. They are perfect for what I needed them - much better than the one I bought from Walmart that was absolutely awful. I’ll used them in my dining room which is my bird room because I have seven cockatiels and they like sitting on the ceiling fan which means a crap on my floor. So, these 3 x 5‘ rugs are perfect for underneath the fan to get the birdie poop. And they are washable. As I said fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: 10BirdGirl

customer_reviews.title: Non-Slip rug pad that really works!
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts that this would work as advertised, but I am very pleased with the results. My living room has hard wood floors and I have a nice throw rug that was always left crumpled up in a pile from my kitten. Since I placed this Ultra Stop Non-Slip under it, she has not been able to mess the rug up. The rug stays put where it’s supposed to be. My rug isn’t very heavy so I can’t guarantee that the backing will work for a heavier rug, but for my rug, I give this non-slip backing pad 5 stars. I love this Ultra Stop Non-Slip Rug Pad and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Size a bit off.
customer_reviews.text: It’s great in keeping the rug in place. However, the size is a bit off and showing underneath the rug. Thus, I had to cut it to fit properly. That’s something I didn’t appreciate and felt a bit bothered by. Sure, it’s cheap, but I feel the sizing should be accurate nonetheless. If you don’t mind cutting it to size (I’d assume the larger the size, the more bothersome it gets) a bit, it’s a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Marie83

customer_reviews.title: Mat didn't solve the problem it was intended to solve.
customer_reviews.text: These 2 productsare nearly identical, and were my first attempts to stabilize 4 rugs and runners of the same fabrication, (3 over hardwood and 1 on laminate flooring), for the sake of my elderly dad and his walker. This matting was inexpensive, arrived promptly, and trimmed easily to fit, BUT only slightly slows the rug's slippage on the hardwood, and the rug on laminate flooring is still gliding like Kristi Yamaguchi in Albertville,. Going to try some corner grippers next.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't use on hardwood floors - leaves sticky residue necessitating sanding and refinishing
customer_reviews.text: This pad is awful. It is somehow paradoxically ineffective at preventing the rugs from slipping in my hallway, and at the same time adheres to my hardwood floors leaving sticky residue behind. It has been under a rug in my hallway for approximately 2 months and now I have a grid of tufts of plastic embedded into my hardwood floors that now have to be refinished. This product may work well on a ceramic tile floor, or maybe even a laminate floor? But it is definitely not good for hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: David Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Do not keep the rugs in place!!
customer_reviews.text: These do not serve their purpose! I thought about giving them one star, but I thought it may be partially my dogs fault that they move around. If not for dogs chasing balls and running like maniacs, they may stay put. Unfortunately, that is what happens in my house. We liked that we could cut them to fit, but I can't return them because I cut them. I need to find replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Nina n TX

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for small rugs
customer_reviews.text: After having this pad down a period of time I am not impressed. Have 2 german shepherds and they still move the 5x7 rug as if there was little under it. Believe the reason is attributed to the design of the pad. It s not a tight weave pattern.
customer_reviews.author: BadDog04

customer_reviews.title: I use it to keep a table cloth in place
customer_reviews.text: I have a small kitchen table with formica top that I use as a desk, which I "beautify" with a table cloth (also makes it easy to keep the desktop clean). I needed something to keep the table cloth from slipping around on the slick table top, so I bought this pad. It works great! No more having the cloth slip off every time a cat jumps on the desk or I move my laptop. I may buy another one for some of my other cat-challenged surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Not very slip proof
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't fallen yet, I expect that I will at some point because this is not as grippy as I expected it to be. The rug moves constantly. It doesn't move much, which is why I haven't thrown it out yet, but it does move and it is noticeable to me (I'm a little OCD). They were accurate with the size though, if that means anything.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Bought a little bigger than the rug and was easy to trim down
customer_reviews.text: This product simply works as intended. No more slipping on the rug over the wood floor or having to continually pull on it to keep it from sliding. This rug pad was easy to work with, just be careful when trimming it down to make sure you're cutting in a straight line. The first cut I used the holes in the material to guide me and ended up with a bit of a diagonal. For the price, I'd suggest buying one size larger than you need, and then using the extra trimmings for some other rugs/runners around the house. There isn't much of a difference between 2 sizes so it works out.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wueste

customer_reviews.title: Just make sure it's FLAT! Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We recently just purchased a home with hardwood floors. Our rug slid EVERYWHERE. With two people and two large dogs... it was impossible to keep in one place for even a day. I wasn't sure if this would work. It's smaller than our 5x7 rug but I like that. I don't have to worry about it showing. And it DEFINITELY has done it's job. Just make sure that is completely flat when putting your rug over it. We rolled the rug and had one person holding the pad completely flat and the other slowly unrolling the rug. It worked perfectly! NO more sliding rug!
customer_reviews.author: Brock sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Left permanent marks on my new hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: I have had this down for 2 years on real hickory factory UV finished hardwood floors in my new construction home. Lifted this week to clean and I have waffle marks all over the floor. I have scrubbed with microfiber towel, I have used an Oreck floor buffer, I have used a citrus degreaser...nothing. I have permanent waffle marks on my floors. Now I will need a rug to permanently be in this location to cover the marks.
customer_reviews.author: Believer

customer_reviews.title: Not for hardwood!!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful before using on hardwood floors. Just went to move rug and found that pad has ruined my hardwood floors. There is a distinct marking that has leaked into the finish. Unable to clean off because it is not a residue on top of finish, but instead likely to be urethane leaking through the floors. I now see that other users also fell victim to this mat. I am so disappointed at the damage that was caused. Do NOT purchase unless you plan on ruining your floors.
customer_reviews.author: oranokime

customer_reviews.title: Great! But sticks to floor and makes a mess.
customer_reviews.text: This was an AMAZING rug pad for what I bought it for. Bought it two and a half years ago and it has served it's design amazingly. I almost gave three stars however... After almost three years of daily use, I'm moving today and picked up the rug and this rug pad had basically stuck itself to the floor. I've spent the past hour trying to get it off the floor and only serious elbow grease is working. I'm currently sweating from the work as I'm writing this review. Basically I wouldn't recommend for apartments or short term rugs. Too messy!
customer_reviews.author: AaronB

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: The product(s) arrived on time, as described by Amazon & manufacturer, it was shipped without issue, arrived within prescribed estimates, the packaging was undamaged, and the product itself was unmolested and made with quality materials. Description, photograph, website presentation, and what arrived are the same-size, shape, color, and it matched my expectations. Great quality, thick enough to give a bit of padding too!
customer_reviews.author: 007Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! And the price is right
customer_reviews.text: Non-slip is so important. The actual rug wasn't an expensive one. This pad makes the rug a bit cozier, too, while being super inexpensive. Just open the pad, lay it down, lay the rug on top, and it works. The rug doesn't slip around from the pad and the pad stays put. What more could you ask for??!!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Mclemore

customer_reviews.title: good for the most part
customer_reviews.text: I like most everything about this rug pad. The pad stays firmly on the floor. That's the most important part as it reduces the chances of falls. The only thing I don't like is that slowly over days the rugs seems to move off of the rug pad and I need to readjust it. I've never had that problem with other rug pads
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Minimally Better Than Nothing
customer_reviews.text: With several dogs in the house constantly rearranging the heavy oriental area rugs on the slippery hardwood floors, something was needed to hold them in place. This wasn't it. Even when the pad was taped onto the underside of the rug and in more than one layer, the rugs still slid around. The product is sturdy enough, hence the two stars, but failed to function as advertised. If it hadn't been cut in a few pieces to fit the rugs it would have been returned. Another product obtained elsewhere (named in the first comment) proved to be much more satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: MrWizard

customer_reviews.title: It's good for a little while
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't last long. When we first got it, it worked very well, but over less than a year's time, it has become weak. The fine dirt that sifts through the rug gets under the non slip pad and causes it to move. It bunches up under the rug creating bulges in the rug. And now pieces of the pad are falling out of it and getting everywhere. I think the fine dirt ruins the pad because even after sweeping it up and cleaning the floor, the pad still moves.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: I'm really happy with this product and I'm sure it's saved me ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my dog slipped and fell hard jumping onto our new rug. When it arrived I trimmed it to size and used a few pieces of rug tape to secure it to the floor and the back of the rug just in case. (I don't think this is entirely necessary, I just wanted to be extra cautious.) This product has performed really well and the rug stays put. I haven't had any issues with it leaving marks on the laminate flooring. I'm really happy with this product and I'm sure it's saved me a trip to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha N.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. I worked in a lot my term care ...
customer_reviews.text: Wonder of wonders. Bought hardwood floors, which posed a safety issue for hubby with a prosthetic. I ordered slide proof carpet runners that I almost preformed the splits on, yaouch, not pleasant for a 54 year old woman that couldn't do the splits ever. So I purchased this, thanks Amazon and MSM industries. Works wonders. I even use it in shower with him, where he walks into it and on the seat he sets on in shower. Perfect. I worked in a lot my term care facility and this is far better than anything used there.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: We have three small to medium carpets on a hardwood floor. We also have a wild young Dalmatian who plays several hours a day. Every time she would run onto those carpets, they would slide across the floor and bunch up against the wall and furniture. We probably straightened them 50 times a day. We bought two of these non-slip rug pads and cut them to size. I used duct tape to tape them to the bottom of the rugs. Wow, they really, really work! Our Dalmatian can slam into them now at full speed and they don't budge an inch. We are MUCH more satisfied that expected and highly recommend these for similar situations.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not working for  me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to go under a rug I just bought BUT it does not work for me. Just wanting to use it under parts of the rug but the rug still is slipping. I am in my 70s and so is my husband now I am worried about falling. Is there a special way to use this. I had a small piece of older and where I put that the corner is staying down.
customer_reviews.author: Edna Tollison

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost to keep a troublesome rug in place!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to keep a road mat I got for my 6 year old in place while he played on it. It fits well underneath with slight trimming, and the rug has not moved since. He is able to sit and play without any trouble of the rug rolling up/sliding around (which was a HUGE problem before, as this rug is almost a felt material on hardwood). A product that does what it should at a relatively good price will always get 5 stars from me :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Grips well. Tears fairly easy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for a project and it happened to tear easier than I thought it would. Seems like it would do what it was planned for well. Ended up putting it under the table rug for extra grip and it does it's intended job well.
customer_reviews.author: Shania

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a Non-Slip Indoor Rug Pad. Arrived on time and works like it should. I would like to add, if they have to be cut and you have a small piece left over it works great for opening hard to open jars :)
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: best value for the size I needed
customer_reviews.text: I used this at bottom of my foam mattress to keep it from sliding. It worked I cut in two to 30 x 36 and put under the upper portion of two mattress where it didn't have the metal brackets that keep mattresses from slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie W.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but is not cut properly to size
customer_reviews.text: The rug pad performs its job very well, however it was poorly manufactured. It seems like a very simple product to manufacture considering that there are straight lines to cut on, but they were not able to do that. When the rug pad arrived, I had to cut off around 2 inches to account for the variations in size on either side. If you don't mind doing a little trimming then you can pick this one up, otherwise just go to bed bath and beyond and pick one up for $5 more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cats like to tunnel underneath it
customer_reviews.text: My dog enjoys sliding on my living room rug. The cats like to tunnel underneath it. I got tired of fixing the rug 6+ times a day and figured I'd give this a shot since I know non-skid rug pads are awesome already. This brand was not any different - it works just like it's supposed to and it's high quality. The pad is the proper size (as listed) - slightly bigger than I needed but easily trimmed. It's being used on tile and it definitely keeps my rug in place... saving me some frustration every single day. :)
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: We have two 2 year old dogs that love to play chase and growl. As a result we were straightening the rug on our wooden floor many times a day. Since we have and this pad we have not had to adjust the rug one single time. I call that success! It is now January 8, 2015 and the 2 three year old dogs still cannot move the rug on our wooden floor as a result of this product. Wish everything we ordered worked this well. Update: Still is working great! Our dogs have yet to get the carpet to slide and it is in prime dog play and wild mood area. Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: johndad5

customer_reviews.title: Hold rugs in place.
customer_reviews.text: We had a kitchen rug that would not stop moving. We have two dogs and a kid so I would find the rug on the other side of the room. This was PERFECT. We’ve had it for a few weeks and the rug stays put! Even when my kid is rough housing or the dogs run through the room! Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jesseca

customer_reviews.title: This is truly non-slip!!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly non-slip! I purchased this rug pad to go under my area rug in the living room because it drives me crazy when the rug shifts and my daughter is always slipping on while playing. This was easy to use, my husband and I rolled up our area rug and placed the pad where we want the rug to go and then we just unrolled the rug on top of the bad. So far this has worked very well. My beautiful area rug now stays put, which is great for my daughters safety and my type A personality. I also like the padding it provides as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Grasl

customer_reviews.title: Damaging light wood floors and doesn’t hold
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn’t hold rug in place and have damaged light wood floors in the house I am renting
customer_reviews.author: Elena Sartori

customer_reviews.title: edges were irregular
customer_reviews.text: Just looked like they had taken a big sheet of the stuff and cut it to size, sort of. alot of irregular edges you will have to cut it to fit likely somewhat. But fine otherwise. Its just a backing anyway
customer_reviews.author: doug

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought an 'area rug' - special order from a carpet specialty shop (big mistake). Without padding it slips dangerously under-foot. The store could not get the padding right so after 2 tries with the "experts" I gave up, tossed both sets of padding (both were dirty to make matters worse) and bought this non-slip pad. I had to trim the ends a bit - very easy with a decent scissor - and it works perfectly. I also used the 2-sided rug tape (using one side only) to keep the edges of the pad perfectly stuck to the perimeter of the rug. Works great, the vacuum goes over it easily - better than the "pros".
customer_reviews.author: dadshop2000

customer_reviews.title: Does the job - not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job efficiently and effectively. It was a little bit of a 'wonky' shape in comparison to my rug runner, so I had to trim it a little bit to even it up, but it worked out.
customer_reviews.author: MJG

customer_reviews.title: Not for a wood floor
customer_reviews.text: Using between a very large 8x10 area rug and wood floor. The rug still moves easily when the dog runs through the room. I'll be purchasing a thicker felt pad to protect the floor better.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an area rug off of Amazon that was sliding around too much. I purchased this and have been very happy with it. It was a little bigger than the rug I had so I cut it down to size. You're rug will not slide around with this product. I like to workout at home, and I roll up the rug and pad together. My only concern is that the pad has started losing little pieces here and there every time I roll it up. It is a great price for an effective product, but be advised you will be doing some extra sweeping if you move it around a lot.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Strong Chemical Smell
customer_reviews.text: I had to send it back when I took it out of the box and could smell the STRONG chemical smell without even taking it out of the bag, yet. It even stated on the bag that it was treated with flame retardants and that was not what I was looking for. I ended up purchasing an eco-friendly version that was not treated with dangerous flame retardants.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle&Bryan

customer_reviews.title: This thing is no joke. Your rug will not ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is no joke. Your rug will not budge no matter how hard you try. Only downside would be thst you have to get the spot perfectly because once you put the rug on it it's on it. You have to pick the rug back up completely to adjust it but that's what you bought it for right!
customer_reviews.author: William and Fallyn

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my rug secure!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and works very well. My hardwood floor is very slippery and my rug would move around constantly. This solved the problem. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: What a fantastic investment. It fits underneath the rug so easily ...
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic investment. It fits underneath the rug so easily and perfect. My Mexico home has slippery tile. This grips nicely and does not leave a mark on the tile. It lifts easily too. The rug stays firm in place and a must for anyone placing any type of rug in their home. It cuts easily. A great investment and price!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Falls Apart
customer_reviews.text: This product perpetually falls apart. We have hardwood floors and have MANY different gripping pads under them without problems. This is the only Non-Slip Rug Pad that continuously sheds hundreds of little pieces of foam that go everywhere. It is an unending task (four months thus far) to keep those pieces vacuumed up?.
customer_reviews.author: Observer Bob

customer_reviews.title: good value and does job
customer_reviews.text: It was good for this type of liner. One of the larger ones was less expensive than smaller size I needed so got and cut. Very easy to cut and does not have to fit exactly. It works on carpet to wood but not so much for carpet to carpet at least not in moving Rv. One caution Check it every year or so as eventually it will harden and stick to floor I never really vacuumed under big rugs and discovered when I rearranged room after about 8 years. I had a smooth nylon edged piece and used it to scrap with No harm to floor. Orientals are lethal on hardwood without it since so easy to slip.
customer_reviews.author: A Hamm

customer_reviews.title: These are a complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These are a complete waste of money. They do not grip my hardwood floor at all, and slipped just as much as if there was nothing under my rug. The rubber material is much too sparse - the squares are to large, and there is not enough of it making contact with the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy M Howell

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Grip the Rugs
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't slip on the floor, but doesn't grip the rugs. The rugs just slide all over it. I've been using 2-sided tape to hold it on to the rugs, but because of all the little holes it has, the tape sticks to the floor, which leaves sticky marks (and dirt) all over the kitchen hardwood floors. I'm going to look for some that don't have the holes.
customer_reviews.author: Awoo

customer_reviews.title: Best for small throw/accent rugs
customer_reviews.text: Not as effective as I had hoped. I purchased this brand to lay under an indoor/our door rug. Indoor/ outdoor rugs because of their course weave have a difficult time “relaxing” after being shipped rolled and I wanted this non-slip pad to help my indoor/outdoor rug lay flat. Three months later and there is still a slight fold in the rug that is no match for this pad. It did a redeeming job with a small 2’x3’ accent rug in my bathroom. Definitely consider your rug type before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, may need to trim
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a small rug in my daughter's room. It works fine but if you're getting it for a 3'x5' rug you may need to trim it a little, otherwise it'll stick out if the rug moves a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Cate

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. We have 3 large dogs who love to run through the house playing chase. They will slide so hard on the rug, that it gets pushed up on appliances, cabinets, and even chair legs. Not anymore! Now our rug will not budge an inch. Actually, I think it improved the rug, because it gave it some lift and cushion, making it feel a little more expensive. It did come out of the package about a 12" larger than advertised, so some cutting was required, hence the 4 stars. Highly recommended product!
customer_reviews.author: Rq

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I have them though because without them
customer_reviews.text: I bought the rug pads for small throw rugs at my doors and in front of my sink. I needed something under the rugs because they would not stay in place and were a falling hazard. They do prevent people from falling, but they do. not keep them in place. Maybe the purpose is only to prevent falling. I am glad I have them though because without them, people would definitely be falling.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well and has definitely made a difference
customer_reviews.text: I got this and cut it to the size I needed. I actually put it underneath a recliner that would slip and slide everywhere on my hardwood floors. It works pretty well and has definitely made a difference, but if I sit down or recline too fast, it still scoots around a little bit. That being said, I know it's made for rugs and would probably do a better job on something that wasn't so heavily used and likely to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office rug. It sits on an oak floor at my desk. Throughout the day the rug creeps around by a few inches as I move my (wheeled) chair on it. I bought this pad to stop this. It had no effect. Update: After living with it for a few days I've concluded that, for my purposes at least, it's worse than useless. It doesn't stop the rug creeping, but it does make it more difficult to return it to the correct position.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: They do what they say—and a little extra!
customer_reviews.text: The pads are cut to be actually 3' x 5' wide—not just to fit under a 3' x 5' carpet. I actually trimmed about 5 inches off the horizontal and vertical dimensions, but that's great because now I have some backing to use under table runners and such. The pads work great; the carpets—which used to drive me nuts with how they used to slip around and creep up the baseboards—stay solidly put. I have repositioned them several times and have not noticed any residue. Very good value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Math Mom

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t do it’s job .
customer_reviews.text: I put this under a classroom rug. Multiple people tripped on the rug from it moving . The rug still moved everywhere and there wasn’t any grip . The pad did not help it stay in place . I ended up having to get rid of the rug because it was a safety hazard in the classroom . Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Mama Igo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Simple Fix to an Annoying Rug
customer_reviews.text: This is a quick and easy way to fix an annoying rug that scoots all over a room. I used this in my daughters' room. They would play and the rug would wind up all over the place. I put this underneath it and trimmed it to fit. It works perfectly. Occasionally, I might have to pull a wrinkle out of the corner, but that takes a second and doesn't happen often. It makes having a rug on a slick hardwood floor so much less of a headache.
customer_reviews.author: R. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Simple inexpensive fix to an annoying problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of this pads to go under area rugs in my living room. They are light weight and easy to position but hold the rug well, even in high traffic areas. What I like best about this option above solid pads is that you can easily shake these pads out to remove any dirt or grit and clean the wood floor below. The heavier pads are much more difficult to move around. They do not really add much "padding" effect, they really function to hold the rug in place well. I would highly recommend these pads if you are mainly looking for a way to keep your rugs in place but not looking for a thick padding effect.
customer_reviews.author: B. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: No more rug sliding!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a rug for my kitchen from Amazon. The rug has a rubber backing, but still slides all over the linoleum floor. This rug pad fixed the sliding problem.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Just right rug pad
customer_reviews.text: I use this beneath a runner in my kitchen, and it completely prevents the rug from slipping around. It also adds a little bit of cushioning—not so much that it's squishy, but it's nice when I'm on my feet for a while cooking. Occasionally my dog knocks the rug off, but the pad never moves. I would never worry about slipping with this, and while the size was perfect for my rug, it would be easy to cut to fit if it were too large. My rug is a Dash and Albert indoor-outdoor rug, and even with the synthetic fibers and relative light weight it works.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Too big, doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The measurements for this pad are extremely off. I'll have to cut it so it doesn't stick out from beneath my rug in certain places (the measurements are not uniform). Additionally, I can't say it performs its function of preventing my rug from slipping. It doesn't really do anything at all aside from stick out beneath my new rug in certain places.
customer_reviews.author: N. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Pretty pointless as it doesn't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Pretty pointless as it doesn't stay in place. Rug still moves around and it bunches up underneath and makes it lumpy and I threw it away, I wouldn't bother wasting the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton C.

customer_reviews.title: Great rug pad that keeps rugs in place!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pad to use under a rug. I have been using this for several months now with a rug that is used almost entirely for aerobic exercise and the rug has not moved an inch. The pad fit my rug almost perfectly. You can't even tell that this pad is under the rug other than it keeps the rug in place. I have not had to move the rug and don't anticipate having to move it in the near future, so I can't say if the pad works as well if you roll it up and reposition it later. I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: T. Vrba

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love Not Slipping!!
customer_reviews.text: I have now had my area rugs on these pads for almost a month and they have not moved an inch unless I moved them!! These are the 9th wonders of the world...I have had hardwood floors most of my adult life and could never find rug gripper pads that would keep area rugs in place on them, but these work better than I could ever have imagined!! If you need non-slip gripper pads for area rugs on flooring other than wall-to-wall carpeting, buy these - you won't regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: csrussian53

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a bathroom rug
customer_reviews.text: We had a rug that kept sliding and became a game with our dogs. This holds the rug in place and no more adjusting 20 times a day. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Rough Rider

customer_reviews.title: This pad a does a good job of holding the rug in place
customer_reviews.text: This pad a does a good job of holding the rug in place. It doesn't add cushioning, but this type of pad is not supposed to. If you want cushioning you need one of the thick pads that costs several times more than this one. Check pricing on different sizes because not all sizes go on sale at the same time. I needed a 12'X15' pad, but I bought this 12'x18' version and cut it to size because when I was shopping the sale price on the larger model was less than for the smaller size. It was easy to cut with standard scissors.
customer_reviews.author: S. DeMott

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It’s your average non-slip carpet liner. I’m grateful for it because I really didn’t feel like breaking my neck on my new hallway runner.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Best Non-Slip Pad Ever Purchased
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this product from Grip-It! I had ordered a different (cheaper) brand prior to ordering Grip It. That brand's non-slip pad was uneven and misshapen. Grip-It brand is a perfect rectangular shape and holds my 8x10 rug in place.
customer_reviews.author: Craft Gal

customer_reviews.title: A little short
customer_reviews.text: My rugs tend to slip; not sure if it is because these pads are little too short for my rugs or just not “grippy” enough but they’re definitely better than no pads at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chevheav

customer_reviews.title: It fit as expected and is keeping a natural/jute type carpet nicely in place in our bedroom
customer_reviews.text: The price was right for this carpet pad. It fit as expected and is keeping a natural/jute type carpet nicely in place in our bedroom. I'm surprised by how much "cooshier" the carpet also feels now too for appearing so thin. I did quite a bit of research to find the best combination of quality and price before settling on this non-slip rug pad and I would absolutely purchase it again!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN THE OTHERS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW What a life saver. The price and the product appear to be superior to my big box store. I highly suggest buying the larger size and cutting it down for your needs. This completely fixed all of our sliding rugs that were becoming issues and the other brands were not working as well.
customer_reviews.author: SK Wire

customer_reviews.title: Great product to keep your rugs from moving
customer_reviews.text: Worked great keeping my rug secure on my laminate floor. Rug hasn’t moved in the past year since we used these grip pads
customer_reviews.author: catlovr1129

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: This rug pad is pretty thin so I was a little worried when I opened the package, but after placing it under my 5 x 7' rug I see that it holds like a champ! The rug is on a hardwood floor and slid out of place so often, so a friend told me about these pads--and their great price--I decided to buy one. I'm very happy with it and bought another for a small kitchen rug as well. It's simple to cut down to size and easy to handle. If you need a good non-slip pad, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good stuff as I said above. I have it under a small rectangular living room rug and a runner, both over hard wood. It works perfect on the living room rug and but less so on the runner. Don't get me wrong, it is a huge improvement from the carpets without runners, but I do have to readjust the rug at least 1 or twice a week to realign so the rug pad is no longer visible. Still, it's enough of an improvement that I will give 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I threw them away because I’m not comfortable with that all over my house
customer_reviews.text: After a few weeks these were shedding a white powdery substance everywhere. A ton of it. I can only assume it’s the fire retardants. I threw them away because I’m not comfortable with that all over my house. I bought 2 so it was a complete waste of $40.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I can’t complain at all but it isn’t the sturdiest, our rug still slips now and then but if you don’t want to spend much just get it
customer_reviews.author: soap

customer_reviews.title: GRAT VALLUE
customer_reviews.text: GREAT NON SLIP RUG LINER. GREAT ADHESION TO CREATE A NON SLIP SECURE HOLD. PERFECTLY MEASURED, AND INEXPENSIVE.
customer_reviews.author: Yashika

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs pushing carpets around the house. So, when I got this thing out of the package, the two door mats seemed to be glued to the floor. My celebration was short lived, however - in a few days the pad dried out - or so it feels. It was first soft, rubbery and tacky, but became stiff and plastic-like, and now not only fails to hold the mat in place, but also sticks out from underneath it and makes things look worse. I also ordered a larger one for the area rug, but do not even want to bother
customer_reviews.author: nbdoc02067

customer_reviews.title: Works on all floor sufaces - very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have hardwood and tile in most rooms, with area rugs and runners. Without grips, some of them slipped around. My cat can't surf the entry-way rug any more, so SHE isn't happy but I am. I was tired of having a bunched up mat at the front door. Now all my rugs remain rooted. My only complaint (and this is minor) is that the grips are sometimes fussy when you pick everything up to clean under the rugs. I discovered it was my fault. I have learned to make sure the floors are desert-dry before putting everything back. Yes, I recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Completely Solved my Rug Problem
customer_reviews.text: My rug was so slippery that I would slip every time I stepped on it, but this completely solved the problem. Even if I drag my foot around on it to test how slippery it is, it does not budge. Plus, it adds more cushioning than I expected, and it fits my 4x6' rug perfectly! (Not to mention it's a great price!)
customer_reviews.author: Derivativemusic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is the same stuff used to line your cabinets with. So I bought this one and decided to go to the dollar store to purchase the liners to make the backing of my other area rugs. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: D. Centry

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these non-slip rug pads to go under two 5x8 jute rugs I ordered. They work great!!!! I would highly recommend them to put under jute rugs so the rugs don't slide. I did have to trim them down a little, although the jute rugs were also supposed to be 5x8.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Scott

product_meta.title: Grip-It Ultra Stop Non-Slip Rug Pad for Rugs on Hard Surface Floors, 12 by 18-Feet
product_meta.description: Size:12' x 18' Rug PadMSM Industries' Grip-It non slip area rug pads help keep rugs in place, prevent bunching and sliding, protect floor surfaces and provide extra cushion and comfort. With over 25 years of rug pad manufacturing experience, MSM Industries offers 15 styles of Grip-It rug pads to meet a wide variety of size and application requirements on hard surface or carpeted floors. All rug pads are easily trimmed to fit for custom sized area rugs and come with a 10 year guarantee to maintain non-slip properties with proper maintenance. Rug pads should only be used on clean, dry, and a fully cured floors. Do not use on lacquered, acrylic or porous surfaces. Please follow the flooring manufacturer's pad type recommendation. Damage to the finish could occur.
feature_bullets: Non-slip rug pad for rugs over hard-surface floors
Open weave construction allows the area rug to breath and helps make vacuuming easier
Helps keep rugs in place to prevent bunching and shifting
Made with polymer coated polyester scrim - guaranteed to hold non-slip properties for 10 years
Care and Use: Hand wash in mild detergent, rinse and air dry

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,291 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
